text:
With Batik 1.1 on Linux, the follwoing svg file produce only one dot instead of
3.

<?xml version="1.0" standalone="no"?>  
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 20010904//EN"   
 "http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-SVG-20010904/DTD/svg10.dtd">  
<svg width="4in" height="2in"   
    viewBox="0 0 4000 2000"   
    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">  
 <defs>  
   <marker id="Point"  
     viewBox="0 0 10 10" refX="5" refY="5"   
     markerUnits="strokeWidth"  
     markerWidth="1" markerHeight="1"  
     orient="auto">  
  <circle cx="5" cy="5" r="5" fill="red"/>  
   </marker>  
 </defs>  
 <rect x="10" y="10" width="3980" height="1980" 
  fill="none" stroke="blue" stroke-width="10" />
   
 <path d="M 1000  750 M 2000  750 M 2500 1250
          M 1000 1000 M 2000 1500 M 2500 1000"
       fill="none" stroke="black" stroke-width="50"  
       marker-end="url(#Point)"    
       marker-mid="url(#Point)"  
       marker-start="url(#Point)"/>  
</svg>
creator: Olivier.Couet@cern.ch

text:
The solution is to implement our own PathIterator (based on the original one) 
but where we keep our own path command list.
creator: tkormann@apache.org

text: We decided to re-open this bug so that Thomas can fix it for beta3 or beta4.
creator: vincent.hardy@sun.com
